Start your brand’s Amazon.in journey by enrolling it in Amazon Brand Registry for free. After enrolling, you become eligible to activate a suite of brand-building tools and protection benefits. You can enroll your brand even if you don’t sell in the Amazon.in store.

t: Who can create a Brand Store?
Brand Stores: Create a brand page on Amazon for free | Amazon Ads
s: Creating and maintaining a Brand Store is free, and you do not need to advertise on Amazon to create a Brand Store. Once you create a Brand Store, you can showcase your products, brand story, and lifestyle content to engage shoppers.

t: Amazon brand usage guidelines for 3-party display ads | Amazon Ads

t: Requirements and tips for enrolling a brand in Amazon Brand Registry - Sell on Amazon
s: June 4, 2024 - Hoping to build your brand with Amazon? Start the process by enrolling it in Amazon Brand Registry, a free program that unlocks your eligibility to access a suite of brand-building tools and protection benefits.

t: 4 insights from Amazon’s latest Brand Protection Report
s: April 4, 2023 - In 2022, we stopped over 800,000 attempts to create new selling accounts, preventing bad actors from publishing a single product for sale—down from 2.5 million attempts in 2021, and 6 million attempts in 2020. Case Study: Amazon's failed attempt to enter the smartphone market
s: June 6, 2023 - In short, Amazon entered the smartphone market in 2014 and exited the market just a little over a year after. Why? Amazon over estimated its brand value and created additional switching cost for customers in an attempt to compete with and differentiate from market leaders

t: Amazon Brand Registry FAQ for Amazon Seller Clients — IdeaLegal
s: Proactive brand protections: Amazon will use information provided about the brand to implement protections that attempt to proactively identify and remove potentially bad listings that could harm the brand and Amazon customers.

t: Why Trademarks Matter to Amazon Sellers - Patent Trademark Blog | IP Q&A
s: February 5, 2024 - Owners of federally registered trademarks who are enrolled in the brand registry may submit Amazon’s Report Infringement form. This can be an effective weapon against competitors who attempt to hijack a listing.
